level.heading: Proper plaintiff.
level.text: A derivative action to enforce a right of a limited liability company may be maintained only by a person that is a member at the time the action is commenced and:
Was a member when the conduct giving rise to the action occurred; or

Whose status as a member was derived, by operation of law or pursuant to the terms of the operating agreement, from a person that was a member at the time the conduct giving rise to the action occurred.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 rewrote the section.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 903 of the Uniform Limited Company Act (2006 Act).
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
